- modernize training of law enforcement personnel

- implement one or more means of providing community oversight of police

4/10

name: Phil Scott
text:
this includes how we do law enforcement. we need a systematic approach to comprehensive police reform. i'm pleased to join with other partners in calling for series of initial reforms, including: 

- require body-worn cameras for all law enforcement officers

2/10

name: Phil Scott
text:
i’ve been inspired by peaceful #blacklivesmatter
 protests we’ve seen across the country and in vermont, crying out for long overdue change. it’s not enough to simply not be racist, we must be anti-racist and work to address systemic injustices in all aspects of our society. 
1/10

name: Phil Scott
text: we have a lot of work to do to build a more equitable vermont and nation. we as a state, and we as individuals, all have a role to play. it is not enough anymore to just say we are not racist. we must be anti-racist, and take action as a nation that is long overdue.

name: Phil Scott
text: reminder: tomorrow marks two months since vermont’s first fatality as a result of covid-19. in honor of the vermonters we have lost to this terrible disease, i have ordered the u.s. and vermont state flags to fly at half-staff on the 19th of every month for the remainder of 2020.

name: J. B. Pritzker

name: J. B. Pritzker
text: tragically, we aren’t going to be able to save everyone from this pandemic. deaths are a lagging indicator – and yet we are already seeing the consequences of rising case rates and hospitalizations across our state, and unfortunately i’m afraid we can expect much worse to come.

name: J. B. Pritzker
text: broadly speaking, hospitalizations are a lagging indicator of rising community spread. we came into this month with an average of 1,570 patients in the hospital fighting covid-19; today, hardly four weeks later, that average is up to 2,700 and growing.

name: J. B. Pritzker
text: region 3 – which encompasses quincy, springfield & much of west-central illinois – has now sustained an average positivity rate of 8% or higher for three days, today hitting 8.8%. starting sunday, they'll join the majority of the state in operating under resurgence mitigations.

name: J. B. Pritzker
text: when national, state & local public health experts all tell them things in their area are getting bad—that more people will get sick & die if they don’t act—their job is to lead, no matter how loudly a minority of people may criticize or how big a personal challenge it may be.

name: J. B. Pritzker
text: local officials have a responsibility in this work as well. they are obligated to take action to keep their communities safe and to carry out the laws and regulations on the books.

name: J. B. Pritzker

name: J. B. Pritzker

text: in order to truly fight inequities and build a better illinois, we have to be able to articulate the history of personal, institutional and structural racism that got us here – and the modern iterations of personal, institutional and structural racism that hold us back today.

name: J. B. Pritzker
text: healing illinois is a bold new initiative pioneered by our own department of human services to support meaningful dialogue regarding race and racism – conversations that we must have in order to move us toward the progress we seek.

name: J. B. Pritzker
text: as we move forward with the general assembly to pass comprehensive criminal justice reform, it is my hope that the nation will look to illinois as a leader in true equity and justice for generations to come.

name: J. B. Pritzker
text: through these principles, we will address the structural flaws of a criminal justice system that has demonstrated itself to be too expensive, too punitive, and too ineffective at keeping all families safe.

name: J. B. Pritzker
text: today, i’m announcing seven principles to build a more equitable criminal justice system in our state – which for too long has disproportionately pursued and punished people of color. you can read them here: https://www2.illinois.gov/pages/news-item.aspx?releaseid=22181…

name: J. B. Pritzker
text: today, a grand jury made a decision that doesn’t capture the injustice of what we know to have happened to breonna taylor. the grand jury’s lesser charge of a single officer does not address the loss of her life. this is, to put it simply, a gross miscarriage of justice.

this is a brand-new program that the federal government rushed to develop & then left each state to create its own separate system. as a result, there were massive holes for illegal fraudsters to steal federal dollars from taxpayers across the us.

a mask is like anything that keeps us safe.

name: J. B. Pritzker
text: under the new plan, we'll transition residents to smaller, regional therapeutic residential centers, invest significantly in community wraparound support and intervention services for justice-involved youth, and increase financial support for victim services.

i'm so proud of you—keep it up!

text: having just surpassed 100,000 covid-19 cases, minnesotans know firsthand that this virus is serious. gwen and i send our prayers to the president and first lady. we wish them a speedy recovery.

text: as our state works to recover and rebuild in the eventual wake of the pandemic and economic crisis, having a complete and accurate count of all those living in minnesota is critical to properly directing the resources we need to return to prosperity.

that’s why as the school year begins, teachers, staff, and child care providers will have access to a free covid-19 test.

name: Tim Walz
text:
minneapolis-st. paul will *not* have a curfew tonight. 

our state patrol and national guard remain ready to support local law enforcement to keep our neighborhoods and businesses safe tonight.

name: Tim Walz
text: thank you to minnesota’s 3,800 highway volunteer groups for 30 years of giving back to our communities!

name: Tim Walz
text: housing is critical to minnesotans’ health and well-being, especially during this pandemic. today we’re launching a $100 million program to prevent eviction and homelessness and help minnesotans maintain housing stability.

name: Tim Walz
Tim Walz
text: let this strengthen our resolve to continue our fight for police reform and accountability until no person has to fear for their lives in the presence of law enforcement due to the color of their skin.

name: Tim Walz
text: last night, jacob blake – an unarmed black man and a father – was shot multiple times in the back by police. gwen and i pray for him as he fights for his life, and for his children who witnessed this horrifying event.

name: Tim Walz
text:
100 years ago, the ratification of the #19thamendment brought us one step closer to a more just and equitable world.
 
today we are reminded that fairness, justice and equality do not come for free, and that we must continue this fight. our work is not done.

name: Tim Walz
text:
@ltgovflanagan
 brings strength and compassion to this work each and every day. i am incredibly proud of my good friend and partner in justice.

we’re ready for the weekend 
  #maskupmn

name: Tim Walz
text: today we recognized 23 minnesota cities that have committed to expanding telecommuting capabilities in their region. more than ever, we must support remote work options to help improve the quality of life for employees and encourage the economic vitality of our communities.

name: Tim Walz
text: rebuilding is about more than a storefront – it’s about the vibrancy and vitality of our communities. grateful our federal partners have stepped in to help. there is a lot of work ahead.

name: Tim Walz
text: minnesota is at its best when we’re looking out for each other. the house and senate dfl engaged minnesotans, community groups, and legislators to lay out a vision for improving the quality of life of all minnesotans. read more

name: Tim Walz
text:
when minnesota students return to the classroom, we need to make sure we’re doing everything possible to protect their health, safety, and well-being. 

that’s why we will provide face coverings for every student, educator, and staff member. #maskupmn

name: Tim Walz
Tim Walz
Tim Walz
text: everyone deserves to feel safe and protected by police. i look forward to signing these long-overdue reforms to strengthen transparency and community oversight, ban chokeholds and warrior training, expand de-escalation training for officers, and reduce the use of deadly force.

name: Tim Walz
text:
george floyd’s death brought the urgent need for meaningful police reform into sharp focus.

last night, the #mnleg passed bipartisan police accountability and reform measures. this is a critical step toward justice.

but this is only the beginning. the work does not end today.

name: Tim Walz
text: i'm asking the legislature to work together on the urgent matters minnesotans expect them to tackle this summer. we need republicans and democrats to rise to the occasion, pass meaningful police reform, fund local jobs and projects, and help minnesotans rebuild and recover.

name: Tim Walz
text: philando castile was killed by a police officer 4 years ago. i’ve been honored to get to know his mother, valerie, who has channeled her grief into action. nothing brings the urgency of police reform to light more than a mother’s pain in losing her son.

name: Tim Walz
text: today is about freedom, celebration, and community. wishing all who are celebrating a festive and healthy 60th somali independence day!

name: Tim Walz
Tim Walz
Tim Walz
text:
minnesotans have been loud and clear: it’s time for meaningful police accountability and reform. we've waited and debated long enough.

we need action and we need it now. that’s why i am working with the 
@dflpocicaucus
 to advance their comprehensive reform package.

name: Tim Walz
text:
today we commemorate a second independence day. june 19, 1865 brought freedom and justice for enslaved black people in texas, two years after the emancipation proclamation. 

we should honor #juneteenth as a state holiday, and i am working with the #mnleg to ensure we do.

name: Tim Walz
text: we are writing history. last night the minnesota house passed legislation that would bring systemic change. the senate should not let this moment pass without meaningful police accountability and reform.

name: Tim Walz
text: today the minnesota house will act on police reform that would deliver real changes to our broken system. these ideas are grounded in months of research and conversations with community.

name: Tim Walz
Tim Walz
text: the people of color and indigenous (poci) caucus put together a package of 21 bills that will bring greater police accountability. their ideas capture the change minnesotans are asking for, and they must be heard by the senate.

name: Tim Walz
text: we’re discussing our local jobs and projects plan, which is part of our effort to build a stronger, more equitable economy. tune in.

name: Tim Walz
text:
this is not the time for smaller and slower reform. 

the clock is ticking 
 

minnesotans want to see police accountability now.

name: Tim Walz
text: to truly be one minnesota, we need to dismantle the systems of oppression that led to the deaths of clayton, jackson, and mcghie 100 years ago, and that led to the death of george floyd just 3 weeks ago. today i met with duluth leaders to discuss how we can and will move forward.

name: Tim Walz
text:
this #flagday 
 we are reminded that fairness, equality, and justice don’t come free. we must continue to fight for and model the values our nation’s flag stands for.

name: Tim Walz
text: minnesotans are asking us to think bigger. we need to meet this moment, not by half measures or checking a box, but with meaningful reform and police accountability.

name: Tim Walz
text: karin housley is a minnesota senate assistant majority leader. tell her minnesotans have waited long enough for action on police reform.

name: Tim Walz
text: paul gazelka is the senate majority leader. he decides which bills reach the senate floor. tell him not to block police reform and accountability.

name: Tim Walz
text: today, 100 years after max mason was wrongfully convicted, i granted him a pardon. it’s critical that we take time to grapple with our state’s history of racism.

name: Tim Walz
Tim Walz
Tim Walz
text: in honor of the funeral for george floyd, we ask all minnesotans to spend 8 minutes and 46 seconds in silence at 11am this morning.

name: Tim Walz
text: tom was a giant. as a voice for the voiceless, a passionate pursuer of justice, a loving husband, and a wise and good-humored father, he made a generational impact on our state. i'm forever grateful for his friendship, his counsel, and his family’s contributions to minnesota.

name: Tim Walz
text:
live: we're responding to 
@agellison
 charging all four officers involved in george floyd's death, and providing an update on public safety concerns. tune in here: 

http://facebook.com/pg/mprnews/posts/?ref=page_internal…

name: Tim Walz
text:
the charges announced by attorney general keith ellison today are a meaningful step toward justice for george floyd.

but we must also recognize that the anguish driving protests around the world is about more than one tragic incident.

name: Tim Walz
text: what will our young people learn about this moment? will his death be just another blip in a textbook? or will it go down in history as when our country turned toward justice and change? it’s on each of us to determine that answer.

name: Tim Walz
text: i laid flowers at george floyd’s memorial this morning. as a former high school history teacher, i looked up at the mural of george’s face painted above and i reflected on what his death will mean for future generations.

name: Tim Walz
text: reminder: a curfew remains in effect tonight from 10pm to 4am in minneapolis-st. paul. thank you for honoring this curfew to help keep our neighborhoods safe, minnesota.

name: Tim Walz
text: my administration will use every tool at our disposal to deconstruct generations of systemic racism in minnesota. this effort is one of many steps to come in our effort to restore trust with communities that have been unseen and unheard for far too long.

name: Tim Walz
text: we’re providing an update on next steps in the state’s response to george floyd’s death at 2:00pm. you can tune in on your local media station.

name: Tim Walz
Tim Walz
text: we have reason to believe that bad actors continue to infiltrate the rightful protests of george floyd’s murder, which is why we are extending the curfew by one day.

name: Tim Walz
text: the curfew on friday and saturday night allowed our law enforcement to target those who meant to do harm to our communities. law enforcement made several arrests and seized weapons, narcotics, long guns, handguns, magazines and knives.

name: Tim Walz
text: at 8pm tonight, it is time to separate out those protesting peacefully in pursuit of justice from those who wish to undermine this movement through chaos. i urge all to respect the curfew in the twin cities as we take necessary action to protect the safety of our communities.

name: Tim Walz
text: many minnesotans are peacefully demonstrating today, and we fully support you. but please know there are people looking to undermine this movement for justice by inciting violence. please go home by 8pm so that we can remove the people who wish to do our communities harm.

name: Tim Walz
text: we will provide an update on our plan to keep minnesotans safe today at 9am. tune into mpr or your local tv news station.

name: Tim Walz
text: the minnesota national guard, state patrol, and local police are on the ground responding to incidents in mpls-st. paul. i urge residents to comply with 8pm curfew and go home immediately. law enforcement needs to respond to emergencies, restore order, and keep minnesotans safe.

name: Tim Walz
text: former officer chauvin's actions were horrific. his arrest is a good first step toward justice for george floyd. but it doesn't change the systemic problems and persistent inequities that led to his death or the pain our communities live with every day. we’re committed to change.

name: Tim Walz
text:
as george floyd’s family has said, he "would not want people to get hurt. he lived his life protecting people." let’s come together to rebuild, remember, and seek justice for george floyd. 

as governor, i will always defend the right to protest.

name: Tim Walz
text: it is time to rebuild. rebuild the city, rebuild our justice system, and rebuild the relationship between law enforcement and those they’re charged to protect. george floyd’s death should lead to justice and systemic change, not more death and destruction.

name: Tim Walz
text: that’s why i’m pushing for a full, fair, and expeditious investigation that will bring us closer to justice. we must continue to examine and address the systemic inequities and discrimination that led to this incident and far too many that have come before.

name: Tim Walz
text: as valerie castile told me: seek justice, seek fairness, and reach out to others. show each other kindness. the world is watching minnesota right now. we need to answer by saying and demonstrating peacefully that we will make change together.

name: Tim Walz
text: our state watched george floyd’s humanity get erased. our feelings of anger, anguish, and disillusionment are justified.

name: Tim Walz
text: the lack of humanity in this disturbing video is sickening. we will get answers and seek justice.

name: Tim Walz
text: #morethaneverbefore we need to be kind to one another and stay connected to the people in our lives. you’re not alone in this challenge, or in managing the increased stress it has caused. #mentalhealthawareness

name: Tim Walz
text: whether it’s a jucy lucy, a plate of tamales, or a walleye dinner, minnesotans can support their local restaurants by enjoying a socially distanced meal outdoors beginning on june 1.

name: Tim Walz
text: communities across the state are counting on the legislature to pass a robust local jobs and projects plan. work together and get this done for minnesotans.

name: Tim Walz
text: with just two days left in the legislative session, the #mnleg needs to act quickly to pass a bonding bill, like my local jobs and projects plan, to boost our economic recovery, create jobs across the state, and make the investments our communities are asking for right now.

name: Tim Walz
text: as we slowly reopen society, we must protect the communities that are most vulnerable to the virus. last week we announced a five point battle plan to protect our seniors, and today i am encouraging minnesotans at greatest risk of serious illness to continue staying home.

name: Tim Walz
Tim Walz
text:
this is challenging for all minnesotans. it’s hard on our lives, our businesses, and our families.

but whether it’s a friend or a neighbor, we reach out and help each other up. that’s who we are as minnesotans, and that’s what it means to get through this together. #oneminnesota

name: Tim Walz
text:
as a parent and teacher, the mental health of our children is a top priority, especially during this pandemic. on children's mental health awareness day, we want to make sure our children have the resources they need. 

https://mn.gov/covid19/for-minnesotans/get-help/mental-health.jsp…

name: Tim Walz
text:
we will:  
expand testing for residents and workers 
create strike teams to provide testing support
provide additional personal protective equipment to facilities 
ensure adequate staffing levels at all facilities 
partner with local public health to coordinate support

name: Tim Walz
text:
native women experience violence at alarmingly high rates. last year i proudly signed into law a task force to examine the causes of this violence. 

today, we commit to making minnesota a place where all minnesotans know their loved ones will get home safe. #reddressday

name: Tim Walz
text:
on #worldpressfreedomday i want to say thank you to the outstanding journalists in minnesota covering this pandemic from the ground-level and keeping minnesotans informed year-round. 

it isn’t free – if you value local news and you’re able, consider subscribing.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text: on this day 19 years ago, in the aftermath of one of the worst attacks in our nation’s history, americans banded together & proved that love is stronger than hate. this tragedy will always serve as a reminder of the strength, resilience, & compassion of americans. #neverforget

name: Gretchen Whitmer
Gretchen Whitmer
Gretchen Whitmer
text: since it’s #nationaldogday, i thought i’d put faces to the barks you’ve heard during interviews over the past few months

text: full statement: https://michigan.gov/whitmer/0,9309,7-387-90499_90640-535194--,00.html…

Gretchen Whitmer
text: today, president trump threatened to send federal law enforcement into many cities, including detroit. frankly, he doesn't know the first thing about detroit. if he did, he’d know detroiters gathered to peacefully protest the systemic racism that black americans face every day.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text:
this is wrong. 

your employer’s opinions should not be able to interfere with your personal health care decisions.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
Gretchen Whitmer
text:
this #pridemonth, i’m reminded of what we’ve learned from our lgbtq+ community:
you’ve taught us to be brave.
you’ve taught us to find joy during difficult times.
you’ve taught us to stand up for what is right.
i’m proud to be your ally, and, as always, i’ve got your back.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text:
as a survivor and a mother, it pains me to see how these new rules will water down title ix protections for our students, which is why i am partnering with 
@dananessel
 in defending title ix.
read the full statement below

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text:
today, we marched.

for george.
for ahmaud.
for breonna.

i will never be able to fully understand the pain that black and brown communities are forced to bear, but i will spend my life fighting for the justice and peace that everyone deserves.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text: today, i requested that the michigan commission of law enforcement standards provide guidance to law enforcement agencies on continuing education, including diversity and implicit bias training, and urging law enforcement agencies to implement duty to intervene polices.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text: [thread] the deaths of george floyd, ahmaud arbery, and breonna taylor were a result of hundreds of years of inequity and institutional racism. i am horrified, heartbroken, and taking action

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text: fighting the coronavirus isn’t only a matter of public health. it is a matter of civil rights.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text:
to those who have taken to the streets to peacefully protest the structural inequities black americans face every day - i’m with you.

tonight, i urge you to stay home and stay safe. tomorrow, find a peaceful protest to join and make your voice heard.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text: this is a moment that calls for empathy, humanity, and unity. we must remember our enemy is racial injustice, not one another. it’s time for all of us to pull together and do the hard work of building a nation that works for everyone.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text:
then, i joined a call with my fellow governors and the current president. 

president trump told governors to ‘put it down’ or we would be ‘overridden.’ he said governors should ‘dominate’ protesters, ‘or you’ll look like a bunch of jerks.’
 
we must reject this way of thinking.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text: yesterday, michigan sheriff chris swanson set an example for law enforcement across the nation. i’m grateful for his leadership, and hope to see many more follow his lead.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text: people in communities of color across the nation and right here in michigan are feeling a sense of exhaustion and desperation. we stand in solidarity with those who are seeking equitable justice for everyone in our state. full statement below

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text: we have to hold those who are perpetuating these abhorrent actions accountable, and in the case of george floyd, that means charging all four officers who were involved. as governor, injustice and unequal treatment under the law will not be tolerated in our state.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text: as americans, we have to stand up for what’s right. the killing of george floyd, and the deaths of people like ahmaud arbery, trayvon martin and renisha mcbride are not isolated incidents. they are victims of a systemic cycle of injustice in our country.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text:
couldn’t have said it better myself 
 #maskupmichigan

name: Gretchen Whitmer
text: on friday, i signed an executive order to create the return to learn advisory council. the council will provide recommendations on how to safely, equitably, and efficiently return to school in the fall. if you’d like to serve on the council, apply at: https://michigan.gov/whitmer/0,9309,7-387-90501---,00.html…

name: Greg Abbott
text:
four brilliant constitutional conservative justices making history on the texas supreme court. 

yesterday i administered the oath of office to the newest member—rebeca huddle (on the right).

these justices apply the law as written rather than imposing their own agenda.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
today i was joined in houston by leaders of the texas senate & house to sign the #backtheblue pledge.

we will pass laws that support law enforcement & defund cities that defund police. 

we will keep communities safe.

#txlege

name: Greg Abbott
text:
21 people from texas & louisiana were arrested in beaumont for human trafficking.

texas has some of the toughest laws in america that crack down on human trafficking.

we thank local law enforcement for taking action needed to #endhumantrafficking.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
texas is providing almost $300 million for public safety initiatives across the state.

this includes funding to crack down on gangs & human trafficking & it funds border security efforts and bullet proof resistant vests for police.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
republicans support law enforcement officers who put their lives on the line every day.

we need them to keep our communities safe.

democrats want to defund & “reimagine” policing. 

that leads to chaos and mayhem like in portland & seattle.

we won’t let that happen in texas.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
congratulations to tim porter on winning 
@sbagov
’s prestigious national small business person of the year award.

tim is a veteran and the ceo of a thriving business in san antonio.

thank you for helping keep texas the best state in the nation.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
u.s. border patrol in texas, with the help of local law enforcement, arrested nearly 300 suspected illegal immigrants in a span of 18 hours. 

about 90 were from countries other than mexico. 

texas will work with ⁦
@cbp
⁩ to secure the border.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
law enforcement officers put their lives on the line every day to keep our communities safe.

this tragic loss is a grave reminder of the dangers they face.

please lift up their families in prayer.

and remember to #backtheblue

name: Greg Abbott
text:
mobs are rioting in streets, destroying businesses & harming residents.

and yet, democrats are defunding police.

we need to support our police.

and we must elect republican judges who will enforce the law & get tough on criminals.

https://youtu.be/dz0ezhgyyca via 
@youtube

name: Greg Abbott
text:
austin police chief's report shows robberies in austin increased over the past year. other violent crimes increased in that time too: aggravated assaults were up 18% & murders were up 40%.

austin is wrong to defund police.

texas will take action.

http://kvue.com/article/news/crime/ut-student-robbed-increase-robberies-west-campus/269-9a865d7d-d7ed-4dd8-b5e6-ef10b2a123c9…

name: Greg Abbott
text:
dallas homicides are on track to surpass last year's record-breaking rate. 

and yet dallas has cut police over time that is needed to deal with violent crime like this. 

my reforms will prevent cities from defunding police. 

we need to #backtheblue.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
austin police association says understaffing causes 911 calls to go hours without a response.

this is caused by austin's cuts to police funding & it endangers lives in austin.

the state must consider laws that take over policing parts of austin.

name: Greg Abbott
text: always great to visit with our brave law enforcement officers. #backtheblue

text:
republicans are going to win. 

up and down the ballot. 

all across the state. 

#keeptexasred

text:

we won't allow the austin city council's refusal to support law enforcement to endanger the university community.
@txdps
 

https://statesman.com/news/20201008/abbott-adds-dps-patrols-to-ut-area-after-string-of-robberies-in-west-campus…

name: Greg Abbott
text:
property crime rising in austin.

this is the kind of thing that happens when cities defund and deemphasize police.

residents are left to fend for themselves.

my plan puts an end to this by requiring cities to fund law enforcement.

#backtheblue

god bless the families who have sacrificed so much for our nation.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
this is good governing:  

mesquite will cut property taxes, and with smart budgeting they will have funds to hire more police officers. 

thanks mesquite, texas, for being such a good example.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
texas is cracking down on rioting.

the constitution permits "peaceable" protests -- but it doesn't provide the right to riot, rob, loot, set fires or physically harm anyone or any property.

we propose 6 laws that punish rioters & protect communities.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
one of the 10 most wanted fugitives in texas was captured. 

he is reportedly affiliated with the bloods gang and was wanted for aggravated robbery and aggravated assault with a deadly weapon. 

thanks to law enforcement for this arrest.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
i applaud san antonio for passing a budget that boosts police spending rather than cutting law enforcement spending like some other cities. 

having well-trained law enforcement is essential to safe communities.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
experts: proposed state takeover of austin police legal, but unprecedented.

well, these are unprecedented times with cities disrespecting & defunding law enforcement.

we will do what is necessary to keep the capital city safe.

#backtheblue

name: Greg Abbott
text:

pray for our neighbors. 

texas will do all it can to help.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
join texans who are signing the #texasbackstheblue pledge.

show america that we won’t allow texas cities to defund police.

that would invite crime & mayhem like we’ve seen in la, portland, seattle &  ny. 

get the pledge at http://gregabbott.com

name: Greg Abbott
text:
some want to defund our police — but we can’t allow it. 

i’m calling on every texan & every candidate for public office to join me in signing a pledge against defunding police tomorrow at 2 pm ct.

download the pledge at http://gregabbott.com/backtheblue & share using #texasbackstheblue

name: Greg Abbott
text:
this is the right approach:

dallas mayor opposes cuts to police overtime.

instead he wants to defund city hall bureaucracy.

name: Greg Abbott
text:
this proposal for the state to takeover the austin police department is one strategy i'm looking at. 

we can't let austin's defunding & disrespect for law enforcement to endanger the public & invite chaos like in portland and seattle.

#backtheblue

name: Greg Abbott
text:
any defunding of law enforcement must start at the top.

any mayor or governor that supports defunding police should lose their security detail.

as austin reshapes police, will mayor adler's security detail be a casualty?

name: Greg Abbott
text:
remarks by president trump august 31, 2020 about importance of law enforcement to reduce chaos in cities:

"i spent a lot of time in texas. and i was with the governor of texas, greg abbott. he was explaining they wouldn’t put up with it for a minute."

name: Greg Abbott
text:
it appears to be open season for gangs, organized crime, and drunk drivers in austin.

austin's defund police budget took an ax to these units.

texas won't take it.

if we have to, the state will take over law and order in austin.

her laughter was contagious and her style was impeccable. no one has ever made a better peach pie. 

her grace through adversity taught me to overcome the accident that left me in a wheelchair. 

she is forever missed.

name: John Carney
text: i know law enforcement officers in delaware. i know they are committed to service and equal justice under the law. the vast majority of officers are in it for the right reasons and want better relationships with the communities they serve.

name: John Carney
text: it’s not an easy job. that’s been especially true recently - as delaware and our country continue to have difficult but important conversations about racial justice and systemic inequality.

name: John Carney
text: serving as a law enforcement officer requires a significant amount of sacrifice - and a willingness to put your life on the line to protect others.

name: John Carney
text:
per u.s. flag code, both the u.s. & delaware flags are to be lowered to half staff due to the passing of u.s. supreme court justice ruth bader ginsburg. flags are to remain at half staff until the day of justice ginsburg’s interment. 
https://news.delaware.gov/2020/09/18/flags-to-be-lowered-for-passing-of-us-supreme-court-justice-ruth-bader-ginsburg/…

name: John Carney
text: justice ginsburg was a defender of our values as a country, and her leadership will be missed. her legacy should drive all americans to continue making progress on issues of equality and justice.

name: John Carney
text: this is a tremendous loss for our country. justice ruth bader ginsburg was a leading voice for equality and women’s rights long before she became an associate justice on the u.s. supreme court in 1993.

name: John Carney

in the days, weeks and months that followed the september 11 attacks, we came together as americans to confront a common threat.

not as democrats and republicans. we aside political differences to protect our country and rally behind our first responders.

name: John Carney
text:
september 11 and its aftermath is the most dramatic reminder in our country’s history that america, and all that it stands for, is worth fighting for. 

let's try to regain some of that spirit, ignore the voices that would divide us up, and come together.

name: Roy Cooper
text:
